basics.name: Farzad Habibi
basics.label: Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: My name is Farzad Habibi. I have just started my Ph.D. in Computer Science studies at the University of California, Irvine. Previously, I studied a B.Sc. in Computer Engineering at the University of Tehran and worked for 9 month as a full-time software engineer at Radin Bourse where we were developing an ultra-low latency trading platform. My interests are mainly in Distributed Systems and Data Management, and I also love programming. :)

work.name: UC Irvine, Edge Lab
work.summary: Doing research on building data infrastructure for distributed systems under supervison of Prof. Faisal Nawab.

work.name: Radin Bourse
work.summary: Building a brand-new matching engine core for Iran's national stock

work.name: University of Tehran
work.summary: Working on virtual network embedding (VNE) which is a well-known problem in network virtualization. I started to learn about Graph Neural Networks which is a novel machine learning architecture by reading abundance number of related papers. We leveraged this method to solve the VNE problem.

work.name: University of Tehran Science and Technology Park
highlights: Under the supervision of Prof. B. Bahrak
work.summary: I was part of the machine learning group. During this 320 hours internship, interns started to read the Hands-on Machine Learning book and participate in Kaggle competitions besides. My internship’s notebooks can be found here.

work.name: Rahnema College
highlights: We designed and implemented an IOS/Andriod application with a feature combination of Instagram & Pinterest
Developed in React Native as front-end and django as back-end
Introduction to Programming and Computing Systems. H. Moradi, M.R. Hashemi (Projects' Supervisor)
Advanced Programming, R. Khosravi (Head Teaching Assistant)

volunteer.summary: IEEE Data Science Winter School of Machine Learning

volunteer.organization: ACM UT Student Branch, F1 Magazine
volunteer.summary: F1 is the magazine of University of Tehran’s Computer Engineering Department

awards.title: CS Department Dean’s Fellowship
awards.summary: I have been nominated for a one-time 10,000$ Dean's Award to support my research in 2021/2022

awards.title: Top 10% of Class
awards.summary: Ranked among the top 10% of the graduating class which included 88 student

awards.title: Iran's University Entrance Exam
awards.summary: Ranked 325 (Top 0.2%) in Konkur(Iranian University Entrance Exam) among more than 160,000 participants

publications.name: Accelerating Virtual Network Embedding with Graph Neural Networks
publications.publisher: IEEE/ACM/IFIP Conference on Network and Service Management (CNSM 2020)
publications.summary: virtual network embedding (VNE) is a well-known problem in network virtualization. We leveraged Graph Neural Networks which is a novel machine learning architecture for graphs to solve this problem with a better performance and scalability.

projects.name: Virtual Network Routing
projects.description: Represents a distance-vector network routing protocol among virtual nodes that are connected via interfaces.

projects.name: Key-Value Store + Gossip membership protocol
projects.description: A full implementation of a distributed key-value store inspired by the Cassandra key- value database using a three-layer architecture.

projects.name: House Prices: Advanced Regression Techniques
projects.description: Using advanced regression techniques like random forest and gradient boosting to predict house prices. (Rank 213 between 5,523 teams in Kaggle)

projects.name: Fraud Detection
projects.description: Using a full exploratory data analysis (EDA), feature engineering and comparing different training models to propose a method to detect frauds in the IEEE-CIS dataset.

projects.name: Gnutella Implementation
projects.description: A full implementation of a peer-to-peer file-sharing system implemented in python and mininet.

projects.name: P. OS
projects.description: A cloned xv6 kernel with some added features for CPU scheduling, memory management, and synchronization.

projects.name: TCP Over UDP
projects.description: An implementation of TCP New Reno over UDP, with reliable data transfer, congestion control, and flow control. Also this im- plementation includes the Nagle algorithm.

projects.name: Proxy Server
projects.description: An implementation of a proxy server in application layer with some extra features like accounting, privacy, caching, etc.

projects.name: Cyber Physical Systems Course's Projects
projects.description: A series of projects to become familiar with embedded hardware and real-time software

projects.name: Real-Time Robotic Arm
projects.description: A real-time robotic arm with recording functionality and high optimization in storage usage.

projects.name: MIPS
projects.description: Implementation of MIPS CPU using VerilogHDL. It includes three phases: single-cycle, single-cycle with pipeline, and multi-cycle.

projects.name: SmoolaCompiler
projects.description: Implementation of a compiler for an object-oriented language called Smoola from scratch -  Implemented in Java in four phase.

projects.name: Titanic Classification
projects.description: An analysis on Titanic disaster  to find out what sorts of people were likely to survive using Machine Learning.

projects.name: Joboonja
projects.description: Implementation of a web application for finding projects to do if you are qualified for them. - Implemented in Java(Spring framework) for backend and JavaScript(React js) for frontend.

projects.name: Store Search
projects.description: Filtering files content and sorting them ascend/descend by field using multiprocess and using pipes to connecting them

projects.name: Intelligent PacMan
projects.description: Using different searching algorithms (Astar, IDS, BFS) to design an intelligent  PacMan in a modified version of the game.
